assignment2

Class Stock

  • java.lang.Object
    • assignment2.Stock

  • public class Stock
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a Stock object, which can be used to store an inventory of Items and manipulate the inventory.
    Author:
    Stanislav Berezin

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.List<Item> inventory 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Stock()
      Represents a Stock object, which can hold an inventory of Items

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addInventory(java.lang.String fileLocation)
      This method is used to add an Item objects to the inventory via an Item Properties csv file.
      void removeAllItems()
      Clears all items from the inventory.
      java.util.List<Item> stockList()
      Returns the inventory as a list of Items

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • inventory

    • Constructor Detail

      • Stock

        public Stock()
        Represents a Stock object, which can hold an inventory of Items

    • Method Detail

      • addInventory

        public void addInventory(java.lang.String fileLocation)
                  throws CSVFormatException,
                         java.io.IOException
        This method is used to add an Item objects to the inventory via an Item Properties csv file. Throws an exception if there are any issues with the format of the csv file
        Parameters:
        fileLocation - - file location of the Item Property file as a string
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - - throws this exception when a problem is detected with IO
        CSVFormatException - - throws this exception for issues around csv file format and data

      • stockList

        public java.util.List<Item> stockList()
        Returns the inventory as a list of Items
        Returns:
        inventory

      • removeAllItems

        public void removeAllItems()
        Clears all items from the inventory. This method is not used in the main program, but is required for unit testing.
